aircraft factories at Berlin/Spandau (138) and tank factory at Berlin/Tegel (100); 10 hit a target of opportunity. 17 B-17s are lost, 1 damaged beyond repair and 234 damaged; 3 airmen are KIA, 4 WIA and 154 MIA.

9 airmen are MIA. Escort is provided by 180 of 202 P-51s; they claim 3-1-3 aircraft in the air and 30-0-14 on the ground; 3 P-51s are lost (pilots MIA), 2 damaged beyond repair and 4 damaged.  2. 418 B-17s are dispatched to Berlin to hit a  munitions dump at Berlin/Spandau (144),

3/ On October 6, 1944 the crew of the B-17 #43-37882 "Happy-Go-Lucky" was on a mission to Berlin. They were damaged by enemy flak and one of their wings caught on fire. They spun down and crashed near Spandau. Only one man survived.

@HRRBFireSafety @drphiliplee1 The Soviets guarded the prison as well.. The British, French and US appealed to the USSR to agree to release Hess from Spandau for years, but the USSR refused partly because Spandau gave the Soviets access to West Berlin.

Fact of the day: Spandau Prison in Berlin, which housed convicted Nazi war criminals including Rudolf Hess, was demolished and turned into a NAAFI supermarket for British forces in 1987, to prevent it becoming a Nazi shrine.

British forces nicknamed the supermarket: Hessco's

@shashj Berlin airlift began with one short runway at Tempelhof and a shorter one at Gatow. RAF also landed seaplanes on lake. With airlift in full swing, the Berliners built a second RWY at T-hof and then Tegel airport.

@LookNoFurther4 No.  Tegel (Fr) was our regular stop when we had to go into West Berlin.

Tempelhof (US) and Gatow (Br) were the other two we occasionally flew into.  Shoenefeld in East Germany was left to the Russians, as the 4th of the Four Powers Agreement airports.

@holland_tom @TheRestHistory I was talking with the Berlin-Kladow local cop one day in 1989 (I lived there 1984-94)). I asked him how long he thought the Wall would remain. He said at least 50 years, and I agreed. We were wrong by 49 years and 11 months. That's how stunningly unexpected it was.

There's a shop in Kladow that serves the best ice cream I've ever had in Europe. 

It's 15 mins from Berlin and there are only two roads in. One has been closed for the last couple weeks. No signs or diversions. Only blocked routes.

Best of luck. The ice cream is awesome.
